com.microblink.uisettings

Class FieldByFieldUISettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microblink.uisettings.UISettings
      • com.microblink.uisettings.FieldByFieldUISettings
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CameraSettingsUIOptions, CurrentImageListenerUIOptions, DebugImageListenerUIOptions, HelpIntentUIOptions, ShowOcrResultUIOptions, SplashScreenUIOptions, SuccessfulImageListenerUIOptions

    public class FieldByFieldUISettings
extends UISettings
implements HelpIntentUIOptions, ShowOcrResultUIOptions, DebugImageListenerUIOptions, CurrentImageListenerUIOptions, SuccessfulImageListenerUIOptions, CameraSettingsUIOptions, SplashScreenUIOptions
    Scan settings for FieldByFieldScanActivity.

      • getHelpAction

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Runnable getHelpAction()
        Description copied from interface: HelpIntentUIOptions
        Returns the Runnable that will be invoked when user presses the help button on the scanning UI. For more information, see HelpIntentUIOptions.setHelpAction(Runnable).
        Specified by:

        the Runnable that will be invoked when user presses the help button on the scanning UI.

      • setHelpAction

        public void setHelpAction(@Nullable
                          java.lang.Runnable helpAction)
        Description copied from interface: HelpIntentUIOptions
        Defines action that will be executed when user presses the help button. If not set or set to null, pressing help button will invoke Intent set by HelpIntentUIOptions.setHelpIntent(Intent). If neither help Intent nor help action is set, help button will not be shown in the scanning UI. If both are set, then this action has priority, i.e. help intent set with HelpIntentUIOptions.setHelpIntent(Intent) will be ignored. Note that since Runnable cannot be serialized and transferred via Intent, this makes only sense if using RecognizerRunnerFragment with compatible overlay. An attempt to save to Intent using UISettings.saveToIntent(Intent), a IllegalStateException will be thrown.
        Specified by:
        setHelpAction in interface HelpIntentUIOptions
        Parameters:
        helpAction - Runnable that will be invoked when user presses the help button on the scanning UI.

      • saveToIntent

        public final void saveToIntent(@NonNull
                               android.content.Intent intent)
        Description copied from class: UISettings
        Saves this scan activity settings to Intent so it can be passed to the corresponding scan activity. Intent target activity must be set before calling this method, and target activity must be compatible with this settings. DO NOT USE THIS METHOD UNLESS YOU KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING. Improper usage will crash your app.
        Overrides:
        saveToIntent in class UISettings
        Parameters:
        intent - Intent to which this scan activity settings should be saved.

        Returns:

      • setInfiniteLoopScan

        public void setInfiniteLoopScan(boolean infiniteLoopScan)
        If set to true, scan activity will never return. Default is false.
        Parameters:
        infiniteLoopScan - whether to activate infinite loop mode or not.

                                  DebugImageListener debugImageListener)
        Description copied from interface: DebugImageListenerUIOptions
        Sets implementation of DebugImageListener interface that will obtain images that are being processed. DebugImageListener will receive all possible debug images that become available during recognition process.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        debugImageListener - Implementation of debug image listener or null to clear listener that has been set previously.

                                       SuccessfulImageListener successfulImageListener)
        Description copied from interface: SuccessfulImageListenerUIOptions
        Sets implementation of SuccessfulImageListener interface that will obtain images from the successful scan. SuccessfulImageListener will receive image when recognition process has successfully scanned an item and has a successful scan image to return.
        Specified by:

      • getTargetActivity

        public java.lang.Class getTargetActivity()
        Description copied from class: UISettings
        Returns target activity. Concrete settings can be used only with the corresponding activity. This method is public for convenience when you are not able to use ActivityRunner. DO NOT USE THIS METHOD UNLESS YOU KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING. Improper usage will crash your app.
